-Install Prisma Client, Prisma adapter for Cloudflare D1, Prisma CLI, Cloudflare's workers types and Wrangler CLI packages:

discussion_comments.comment_body: @nikolasburk can speak about this, we do not use "the" for Prisma Client and co is what I remember.
yup, "Prisma Client" is a proper noun and doesn't get prefixed with an article.

commented_code:
# Prisma driver adapter for Cloudflare D1
 
-**INTERNAL PACKAGE, DO NOT USE**
+Prisma driver adapter for [Cloudflare's Serverless Driver D1](https://developers.cloudflare.com/d1/). Refer to the [announcement blog post](https://prisma.io/cloudflare-d1) and our [docs](https://www.prisma.io/docs/guides/database/cloudflare-d1) for more details.

discussion_comments.comment_body: Those adapters are for "serverless drivers", which are the Npm libraries we integrate that are made specifically for serverless (And edge) environments but are called "serverless drivers" by their authors. That is not hte case for D1, that is probably just an API or similar. It's not even a package, right, it just magically exists on deployment.
